results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Visions of perfection
results.creator_credit: Diane Charleson, Prahran School Support Centre and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Victoria College of the Arts provides a venue for talented children in the performing arts of music and dance to combine these with their academic studies in a high school setting. A student violinist, percussionist, ballet dancer and pianist talk about the courses available and demonstrate some of the activities in the school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Charleson, Prahran School Support Centre and TV Ed Productions

results.title: Two languages are better than one
results.creator_credit: Jan Denton, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A bilingual program offers instruction in two languages. Substantial community support is required to successfully establish a bilingual program. This may be forcoming if people are provided with sufficient information upon which to base fruitful discussion. This video provides a starting point for such discussion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Denton, John Moore and Open Channel Productions

results.title: The Right ingredients
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, George Cass, Arts Victoria, Australian Bicentennial Authority, Australian Film Commission, Department of Sport and Recreation and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A look behind the scenes of the Australian Ballet School and the preparations of blocking the dancers in the classroom to the final performance. We see students rehearsing and dancing to the modern ballet “Signatures” and the classical ballet “The Nutcracker”. Contains commentary from Dame Margaret Scott and Kevin Coe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke, George Cass, Arts Victoria, Australian Bicentennial Authority, Australian Film Commission, Department of Sport and Recreation and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Movietone memories
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver, Film World and Tru-Vu Pictures
results.brief_description: A unique time capsule of our country’s past as captured by the Movietone news crews from the early thirties though to the mid fifties. The headlines, our sporting achivements, the tragedies, and our nation’s often off-beat sense of humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver, Film World and Tru-Vu Pictures

results.title: Local interest
results.brief_description: An overview of the developmental work of the six school support centres in the Southern Metropolitan Region in 1988. Managers explain the various programs being undertaken in the region and the cooperation between schools and the community.

results.title: Listen to us - the way we speak. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Barbara Wethey and Inner London Education Authority
results.brief_description: Part 1. “Listen to us”: “Linguistic and Cultural Diversity”. Britain now has a multi-ethnic and multicultural society which is also multilingual. This program acknowledges that diversity in order to benefit pupils. Part 4. “The Way We Speak”: “Considering Dialect and Learning”. Considers whether schools should permit and teach dialects of the English language. In both of these programs we see activities which may help to develop and reinforce language, showing teachers using the activities in actual classrooms. Companion videotape “Working Together in the Classroom; Supporting Understanding”
results.title_for_label: Listen to us - the way we speak. Part 1
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Wethey and Inner London Education Authority

results.title: Letter to Santa
results.creator_credit: John Davis, Ursula Kolbe and Davis Film and Video Production
results.brief_description: An enchanting puppet story about a country which is desperately short of water. Sally writes to Santa, saying that she will forgo presents this year if he can only make it rain. Santa builds a giant snowball and tows it behind his sleigh all the way to Australia but the snowball is too heavy.
